title: How Rich People Think
author: Steve Stebold
review: It's a pretty thin book. The observations align to what I see, but this feels like another one of those blog post converted books. It recommends one book per chapter that is quite disrupting and almost feel like this is not a book by the author. The content is still decent and I would recommend checking it out from your local library.

title: Rich Dad's Guide to Becoming Rich - Without Cutting Up Your Credit Cards
author: Robert Kiyosaki
review: It was a pretty short read. It surprising how this book that was published almost 10+ years ago still somewhat apply to this modern day. A lot of the good saying today from those financial gurus were probably taken from this book.

title: F.U. Money: Make As Much Money As You Want And Live Your Life As You Damn Well Please!
author: Dan Lok
review: This is the book that made me realized that time is the most precious and irreplaceable asset that I have. I would very much say that I wouldn't be where I am today without reading this book. The author is a bit controversial, but I personally think the content of this particular book is good. I would highly recommend this book if you can excuse his use of profanity and harsh words.
